title: Port Said
summary: Port Said (Arabic: بورسعيد‎ Borsaʿīd [boɾ.sæˈʕiːd]) is a city that lies in north east Egypt extending about 30 kilometres (19 mi) along the coast of the Mediterranean Sea, north of the Suez Canal. With an approximate population of 603,787 (2010), it is the fifth-largest city in Egypt.[2] The city was established in 1859 during the building of the Suez Canal.
